title: The Best Scalloped Bedding to Romanticize Your Bedscape (2025)
description: Add this charming design to your linen closet
author: Yelena Moroz Alpert
excerpt: We found the best scalloped bedding to add a charming design to your bedroom. Find our favorites from Quince, Pom Pom at Home, West Elm, and more
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.The best scalloped bedding may be the trend du jour and a true companion of cottagecore bedding, but the charming design goes back to the Renaissance and Victorian periods. In fact, Louis XIV and Queen Anne were rumored fans of the scallop detail. That’s why we picked the best options fit for royalty, but suited for the everyday.Adding bed linens, pillow shams, and throws with this scooped shape elevates even the most basic coverlet or duvet set. While a scalloped edge will romanticize floral sheets even further, when paired with a deep navy hue and a more loopy motif your bedding set will skew coastal. Here, 13 of the best scalloped bedding sets and accessories that get you out of the bedroom doldrums.Our Top Picks for the Best Scalloped Bedding:A Statement Pillow: Tov Furniture Scalloped Edge Throw Pillow, $48 $41Best Duvet Cover Set: Quince European Linen Double Embroidered Edge Duvet Cover Set, $347 $150For a Coastal-Inspired Bedroom: Serena & Lily Baywood Quilt, $398 $319Whimsical Bed Sheets: West Elm Rhode Begonia Sheet Set, $139A Maximalist Quilt: Anthropologie Iluka Cotton Printed Floral Quilt, $198Tov Furniture Scalloped Edge Throw PillowTov Furniture puts a modern spin on the scalloped edge of this decorative pillow by creating a wavy trim that can work equally well in a bed with gingham sheets or as an accent pillow against solid colors. The velvet cover feels plush to the touch. And at this sale price, you’ll likely want more than one.Quince European Linen Double Embroidered Edge Duvet Cover SetWhile technically not a true scallop edge, the embroidery on the Quince European linen duvet set gives off an undulating texture that reads like a natural wave thanks to organic wrinkling. The sand-colored linens and terracotta embroidery are on point when it comes to the earthy color palettes that are so prevalent in bedrooms these days.Serena & Lily Baywood QuiltCoastal meets cottagecore. The Serena & Lily Baywood quilt makes us think of artisanal bedding—just look at the hand-pick stitching detail. You’ll definitely want to add the Baywood sham to your cart, too. The sky-blue edge is like a welcome hello wave every time you enter your bedroom. But you can also be a purist and go all in with white.West Elm Rhode Begonia Sheet SetThe dainty flowers of the West Elm Rhode Begonia 200-thread-count sheet set come into two colorways (bright blue and Dijon yellow), each with a corresponding curvy stitched edge. It’s just the type of craftsmanship that differentiates basic bedding from a place you don’t want to leave on a Sunday morning.Anthropologie Iluka Cotton Printed Floral QuiltAnthropologie never fails when it comes to bringing floral motifs, and we are dizzy with joy for the perky marigolds on the Iluka cotton quilt with the perfect scalloped edge. As if the print wasn’t reason enough, it’s actually reversible and has a white ditsy floral pattern set against a chartreuse backdrop. Your order wouldn’t be complete without matching shams.The Company Store Company Cotton Embroidered Scallop Sateen Bed Sheet SetFew things rival classic white sheets, but adding just a bit of extra detail take this 300-thread-count combed cotton sateen set to an entirely new level. The scallop detail almost looks like peony petals, especially if you opt for the blush trim. But if you’re more of a minimalist, there is also white and grey. These even come in twin/twin xl should you want to give these to a grad.Pom Pom At Home Kelly Linen Duvet CoverOne look at the Lulu and Georgia Kelly linen duvet cover and euro shams by Pom Pom at Home and you’ll want to hop into bed. The crisp lines of the scallop edge are a nice contrast to the textured linen fabric. For a more rustic look, consider the flax colorway.Anthropologie John Robshaw Kimari Euro ShamThink of the John Robshaw Kimari soft jacquard cotton chenille euro sham as the accoutrement to your bedroom decor. The floral pattern of the renowned textile designer gives a nod to the Arts and Crafts Movement and will pair well against a walnut wood headboard.To tap into the Renaissance style, why not go with bougie burgundy? All you need to do is fall into bed to feel the quality of 400 thread count long staple cotton sateen weave. (FYI: Long staple yarn is softer, smoother, and less likely to pilling). You can choose from 16 trim colors that span gold to navy.Pottery Barn LoveShackFancy Blue Rose ShamFor the ultimate romantic, look no further than LoveShackFancy. The ruffled lace sham with a scalloped edge frames the embroidered blue roses on the front. Breakfast in bed is the way to go with this gorgeous design. Or perhaps a Bridgerton marathon is in the books?Ballard Designs Emma Scalloped BedskirtGive your bed an extra layer with the Ballard Designs Emma scalloped bed skirt. It comes with five trim colors (including blue, pink, and grey) but we like the white-on-white because it gives the bed a more structured, yet regal look. With more than 400 5-star reviews, this cotton twill bed skirt is clearly a favorite. Bonus: the crisp pleat design is made to accommodate corner posts.Pottery Barn Scallop ThrowThe casual scalloped detailing woven into the Pottery Barn Teen throw gives it a darling sensibility. Keep it at the foot of your bed if you need to ward off a chill. Don’t be surprised if your cat claims it as his own. But don’t worry, it is machine washable so you can toss it in for a refresh any time.Crate & Barrel Amalfi Scallop EdgeThrow Pillow with Feather InsertA nautical motif is perfect for a beach house or a guest bedroom and the Crate & Barrel Amalfi scallop edge throw pillow delivers. The exterior is European flax linen and the feather-down insert with its organic cotton shell is the ideal medium firmness.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

The best scalloped bedding may be the trend du jour and a true companion of cottagecore bedding, but the charming design goes back to the Renaissance and Victorian periods. In fact, Louis XIV and Queen Anne were rumored fans of the scallop detail. That’s why we picked the best options fit for royalty, but suited for the everyday.

Adding bed linens, pillow shams, and throws with this scooped shape elevates even the most basic coverlet or duvet set. While a scalloped edge will romanticize floral sheets even further, when paired with a deep navy hue and a more loopy motif your bedding set will skew coastal. Here, 13 of the best scalloped bedding sets and accessories that get you out of the bedroom doldrums.

Our Top Picks for the Best Scalloped Bedding:

  • A Statement Pillow: Tov Furniture Scalloped Edge Throw Pillow, $48 $41
  • Best Duvet Cover Set: Quince European Linen Double Embroidered Edge Duvet Cover Set, $347 $150
  • For a Coastal-Inspired Bedroom: Serena & Lily Baywood Quilt, $398 $319
  • Whimsical Bed Sheets: West Elm Rhode Begonia Sheet Set, $139
  • A Maximalist Quilt: Anthropologie Iluka Cotton Printed Floral Quilt, $198

Tov Furniture Scalloped Edge Throw Pillow

Tov Furniture puts a modern spin on the scalloped edge of this decorative pillow by creating a wavy trim that can work equally well in a bed with gingham sheets or as an accent pillow against solid colors. The velvet cover feels plush to the touch. And at this sale price, you’ll likely want more than one.

Quince European Linen Double Embroidered Edge Duvet Cover Set

While technically not a true scallop edge, the embroidery on the Quince European linen duvet set gives off an undulating texture that reads like a natural wave thanks to organic wrinkling. The sand-colored linens and terracotta embroidery are on point when it comes to the earthy color palettes that are so prevalent in bedrooms these days.

Serena & Lily Baywood Quilt

Coastal meets cottagecore. The Serena & Lily Baywood quilt makes us think of artisanal bedding—just look at the hand-pick stitching detail. You’ll definitely want to add the Baywood sham to your cart, too. The sky-blue edge is like a welcome hello wave every time you enter your bedroom. But you can also be a purist and go all in with white.

West Elm Rhode Begonia Sheet Set

The dainty flowers of the West Elm Rhode Begonia 200-thread-count sheet set come into two colorways (bright blue and Dijon yellow), each with a corresponding curvy stitched edge. It’s just the type of craftsmanship that differentiates basic bedding from a place you don’t want to leave on a Sunday morning.

Anthropologie Iluka Cotton Printed Floral Quilt

Anthropologie never fails when it comes to bringing floral motifs, and we are dizzy with joy for the perky marigolds on the Iluka cotton quilt with the perfect scalloped edge. As if the print wasn’t reason enough, it’s actually reversible and has a white ditsy floral pattern set against a chartreuse backdrop. Your order wouldn’t be complete without matching shams.

The Company Store Company Cotton Embroidered Scallop Sateen Bed Sheet Set

Few things rival classic white sheets, but adding just a bit of extra detail take this 300-thread-count combed cotton sateen set to an entirely new level. The scallop detail almost looks like peony petals, especially if you opt for the blush trim. But if you’re more of a minimalist, there is also white and grey. These even come in twin/twin xl should you want to give these to a grad.

Pom Pom At Home Kelly Linen Duvet Cover

One look at the Lulu and Georgia Kelly linen duvet cover and euro shams by Pom Pom at Home and you’ll want to hop into bed. The crisp lines of the scallop edge are a nice contrast to the textured linen fabric. For a more rustic look, consider the flax colorway.

Anthropologie John Robshaw Kimari Euro Sham

Think of the John Robshaw Kimari soft jacquard cotton chenille euro sham as the accoutrement to your bedroom decor. The floral pattern of the renowned textile designer gives a nod to the Arts and Crafts Movement and will pair well against a walnut wood headboard.

To tap into the Renaissance style, why not go with bougie burgundy? All you need to do is fall into bed to feel the quality of 400 thread count long staple cotton sateen weave. (FYI: Long staple yarn is softer, smoother, and less likely to pilling). You can choose from 16 trim colors that span gold to navy.

Pottery Barn LoveShackFancy Blue Rose Sham

For the ultimate romantic, look no further than LoveShackFancy. The ruffled lace sham with a scalloped edge frames the embroidered blue roses on the front. Breakfast in bed is the way to go with this gorgeous design. Or perhaps a Bridgerton marathon is in the books?

Ballard Designs Emma Scalloped Bedskirt

Give your bed an extra layer with the Ballard Designs Emma scalloped bed skirt. It comes with five trim colors (including blue, pink, and grey) but we like the white-on-white because it gives the bed a more structured, yet regal look. With more than 400 5-star reviews, this cotton twill bed skirt is clearly a favorite. Bonus: the crisp pleat design is made to accommodate corner posts.

Pottery Barn Scallop Throw

The casual scalloped detailing woven into the Pottery Barn Teen throw gives it a darling sensibility. Keep it at the foot of your bed if you need to ward off a chill. Don’t be surprised if your cat claims it as his own. But don’t worry, it is machine washable so you can toss it in for a refresh any time.

Crate & Barrel Amalfi Scallop EdgeThrow Pillow with Feather Insert

A nautical motif is perfect for a beach house or a guest bedroom and the Crate & Barrel Amalfi scallop edge throw pillow delivers. The exterior is European flax linen and the feather-down insert with its organic cotton shell is the ideal medium firmness.
